channel.title: ü•∑ Incident Response on Analyst
channel.description: Recent content in ü•∑ Incident Response on Analyst

item.title: Incident Response üóí
item.description: Phases: Preparation, Detection & Analysis, Containment, Eradication & Recovery, Post Incident Activity. Event vs Incident. IDS alert may be considered as an event before it’s confirmed.

item.title: IR Playbooks
item.description: These are my ideas on IR playbooks for training. Don’t judge :) We don’t evolve if we don’t make mistakes and learn from them. And we don’t make mistakes if we do nothing. Even if I am risking to become an object of ridicule, I am posting this article. I am planning to imporve once I learn more or gain some relevant experience.

item.title: Firewalls üî•
item.description: Firewalls monitor access from the outside network to the inside network. Traffic originating from inside the network would not pass through the firewall.???

item.title: IDS And IPS ‚úã
item.description: Host-based IDS look for local system configurations and behaviour, while network-based IDS look for network connections and looks for anomalies and common signatures.

item.title: Defence Mechanisms ‚öîÔ∏è
item.description: Attackers need to collect information about the target system first: ping, nmap. Countermeasures: record traffic look for suspicious activity use a host scanner and keep track of all the PCs withing your network.

item.title: Phishing üé£
item.description: Phishing, aka brand spoofing, aka carding - various scam that primarily use e-mail messages to trick a person into divulging personal information.

item.title: Point of Sale Breach üí≥
item.description: The main purpose is to steal the 16-digit card number üí≥. Restraunts, retail, frocey are the most affected.

item.title: Countering Evasion Techniques ü¶ë
item.description: Evasion techniques and what possible forensic footprints they are likely to leave? VPN Virtual private network.
